conclusion: Consider forces on each segment of the wire due to magnetic fields.
Wire AB is in a magnetic field pointing inward; wire BC is in a magnetic field pointing outward.
Force on AB is calculated using F = I * L * B * sin(90°) = I * L * B.
Force on BC is calculated using F = I * L * B * sin(90°) = I * L * B.
Determine direction of forces using the right-hand rule.
Resolve forces into components; angle between force on AB and horizontal is 30°.
Calculate x and y components of force on AB: F_ABx = I * L * B * cos(30°), F_ABy = I * L * B * sin(30°).
Calculate x and y components of force on BC: F_BCx = -I * L * B * cos(30°), F_BCy = I * L * B * sin(30°).
Sum the components: F_x = 0, F_y = 2 * I * L * B * sin(30°).
Calculate magnitude of total force: F = I * L * B.
Final answer: Magnitude of Ampere force is I * L * B.
